moves.1. e4 c5 2. Nf3 g6 3. Nc3 Bg7 4. Bc4 e6: one of these games, where we trust too much on our beloved systems... e6 is my designated move in the Hungarian variation, to prepare and play Ne7 and d5... but after Nc3 things have changed; best here is just d6, 0-0, Nf6, d4, cxd4 etcetera...
moves.8. Ndb5: there you have it; Black is getting in trouble; best now is d5, exd5, a6, d6!, axb5, dxe7. Qxe7, Bxb5, Nc6...
moves.8... Bxc3: a terrible move and probably already the losing one...
moves.9. Nxc3 a6: from bad to worse; Qc7, Bb3, Nbc6, or again d5 and trade off the center pawns, could have saved at least something...
moves.13. Qd2 Bb7 14. Rad1 Qc5 15. Qd6 Qxd6 16: a spark of hope for Black; White should have played e5, or at least a3...
moves.21... Kf8 22. Rxb2 Rb8 23. Rb1 a5 24. Ba: things are over; the a pawn will end this... resigned...

gameName: Fierce Queen on a bad day...
